author: mmusich
body:
backport of https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/48646

#### PR description:

This PR is a follow-up to https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/48450.
When inspecting the output of the DQM online scouting distributions for 2025 data-taking I noticed that the rate of objects to monitor is such that we are exhausting the number of entries per bin in single precision, see e.g. https://tinyurl.com/2bbsyrpx or https://tinyurl.com/23rw78su (certain bins getting capped at a fixed value).
The goal of this PR is to book the various distributions to be monitored as `TH1D` instead of `TH1F` (similarly in spirit to what was done for https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/45225, see also issue https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/45183).
Additionally I provide commit d091e885ce88e49b2429692ad7e8dbb7574ec404, in which the `onlyScouting` flag for `ScoutingCollectionMonitor` is flipped to false. This is possible because we're actually saving the `hltOnlineMetaDataDigis` to `DQMOnlineScouting` stream (see also [CMSHLT-3585](https://its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CMSHLT-3585)).

#### PR validation:

`scram b runtests_TestDQMOnlineClient-scouting_dqm_sourceclient` runs fine and without warnings.

#### If this PR is a backport please specify the original PR and why you need to backport that PR. If this PR will be backported please specify to which release cycle the backport is meant for:

Verbatim backport of https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/48646 to CMSSW_15_0_X for data-taking operations.
title: [15.0.X] Improvements to `ScoutingCollectionMonitor`
